segment.source: Here’s some important info you’ll need to ensure that you receive payment for your apps, in-app products (IAPs), and Microsoft Advertising earnings.
segment.target: Here’s some important info you’ll need to ensure that you receive payment for your apps, in-app products (IAPs), and Microsoft Advertising earnings.

segment.source: Getting paid
segment.target: Getting paid

segment.source: Getting paid
segment.target: Getting paid

segment.source: Here’s some important info you’ll need to ensure that you receive payment for your apps, in-app products (IAPs), and Microsoft Advertising earnings.
segment.target: Here’s some important info you’ll need to ensure that you receive payment for your apps, in-app products (IAPs), and Microsoft Advertising earnings.

segment.source: Important Before you can receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and and fill out the necessary tax forms.
segment.target: Important Before you can receive money from app sales in the Windows Store, you need to set up your payout account and and fill out the necessary tax forms.

segment.source: Store fee
segment.target: Store fee

segment.source: When you sign up for a developer account, you accept the App Developer Agreement.
segment.target: When you sign up for a developer account, you accept the App Developer Agreement.

segment.source: This agreement explains the relationship between you and Microsoft as it pertains to selling apps in the Windows Store, including the Store fee that Microsoft charges for every sale made.
segment.target: This agreement explains the relationship between you and Microsoft as it pertains to selling apps in the Windows Store, including the Store fee that Microsoft charges for every sale made.

segment.source: In most cases, the Store fee is 30%.
segment.target: In most cases, the Store fee is 30%.

segment.source: Fees are officially defined in the App Developer Agreement.
segment.target: Fees are officially defined in the App Developer Agreement.

segment.source: Always review that document if you have any questions.
segment.target: Always review that document if you have any questions.

segment.source: The Windows Store fee is applied to all app sales collected by the Windows Store, including IAPs.
segment.target: The Windows Store fee is applied to all app sales collected by the Windows Store, including IAPs.

segment.source: Price tiers
segment.target: Price tiers

segment.source: The price tier sets the sales price in all the countries where you choose to distribute your app.
segment.target: The price tier sets the sales price in all the countries where you choose to distribute your app.

segment.source: You can offer your app for free, or you can pick a price that customers must pay to acquire your app.
segment.target: You can offer your app for free, or you can pick a price that customers must pay to acquire your app.

segment.source: Price tiers start at .99 USD, with additional increments (1.29 USD, 1.49 USD, 1.99 USD, and so on).
segment.target: Price tiers start at .99 USD, with additional increments (1.29 USD, 1.49 USD, 1.99 USD, and so on).

segment.source: The increments between price tiers increase as the price gets higher.
segment.target: The increments between price tiers increase as the price gets higher.

segment.source: Note These price tiers also apply to any IAPs that you offer from within your app.
segment.target: Note These price tiers also apply to any IAPs that you offer from within your app.

segment.source: Each price tier has a corresponding value in each of the more than 60 currencies offered by the Store.
segment.target: Each price tier has a corresponding value in each of the more than 60 currencies offered by the Store.

segment.source: We use these values to help you sell your apps at a comparable price point worldwide.
segment.target: We use these values to help you sell your apps at a comparable price point worldwide.

segment.source: However, due to changes in foreign exchange rates, the exact sales amount may vary slightly from one currency to another.
segment.target: However, due to changes in foreign exchange rates, the exact sales amount may vary slightly from one currency to another.

segment.source: Keep in mind that the price tier you select may include sales or value-added tax that your customers must pay.
segment.target: Keep in mind that the price tier you select may include sales or value-added tax that your customers must pay.

segment.source: See Tax details for paid apps for more info.
segment.target: See Tax details for paid apps for more info.

segment.source: Payout reporting
segment.target: Payout reporting

segment.source: You can access details about your payment info and download reports in the Payout summary of the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: You can access details about your payment info and download reports in the Payout summary of the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: For more about the info shown here, and how we categorize the money you earn, see Payout summary.
segment.target: For more about the info shown here, and how we categorize the money you earn, see Payout summary.

segment.source: Payout timeframe
segment.target: Payout timeframe

segment.source: Payments are made on a monthly basis (provided the applicable payment threshold has been met and you haven’t placed your payout on hold as described below).
segment.target: Payments are made on a monthly basis (provided the applicable payment threshold has been met and you haven’t placed your payout on hold as described below).

segment.source: We'll typically send any payment due in a given month by the 15th day of that month.
segment.target: We'll typically send any payment due in a given month by the 15th day of that month.

segment.source: Note that payments generally take between 3 to 10 additional business days to reach your payout account.
segment.target: Note that payments generally take between 3 to 10 additional business days to reach your payout account.

segment.source: Payout hold status
segment.target: Payout hold status

segment.source: By default, we’ll send payments on a monthly basis as described above.
segment.target: By default, we’ll send payments on a monthly basis as described above.

segment.source: However, you have the option to put your payouts on hold, which will prevent us from sending payments to your account.
segment.target: However, you have the option to put your payouts on hold, which will prevent us from sending payments to your account.

segment.source: If you choose to put your payouts on hold, we’ll continue to record any revenue that you earn and provide the details in your Payout summary.
segment.target: If you choose to put your payouts on hold, we’ll continue to record any revenue that you earn and provide the details in your Payout summary.

segment.source: However, we won’t send any payments to your account until you remove the hold.
segment.target: However, we won’t send any payments to your account until you remove the hold.

segment.source: To place your payments on hold, go to Account settings.
segment.target: To place your payments on hold, go to Account settings.

segment.source: Under Financial details, in the Payout hold status section, toggle the slider to On.
segment.target: Under Financial details, in the Payout hold status section, toggle the slider to On.

segment.source: You can change your payout hold status at any time, but be aware that your decision will impact the next monthly payout.
segment.target: You can change your payout hold status at any time, but be aware that your decision will impact the next monthly payout.

segment.source: For example, if you want to hold April’s payout, make sure to set your payout hold status to On before the end of March.
segment.target: For example, if you want to hold April’s payout, make sure to set your payout hold status to On before the end of March.

segment.source: Once you have set your payout hold status to On, all payouts will be on hold until you toggle the slider back to Off.
segment.target: Once you have set your payout hold status to On, all payouts will be on hold until you toggle the slider back to Off.

segment.source: When you do so, you’ll be included during the next monthly payout cycle (provided any applicable payment thresholds have been met).
segment.target: When you do so, you’ll be included during the next monthly payout cycle (provided any applicable payment thresholds have been met).

segment.source: For example, if you’ve had your payouts on hold, but would like to have a payout generated in June, then make sure to toggle the payout hold status to Off before the end of May.
segment.target: For example, if you’ve had your payouts on hold, but would like to have a payout generated in June, then make sure to toggle the payout hold status to Off before the end of May.

segment.source: Important Your Payout hold status selection applies to all revenue sources that are paid through Windows Dev Center (Windows Store, Microsoft Advertising, Azure Marketplace, etc.).
segment.target: Important Your Payout hold status selection applies to all revenue sources that are paid through Windows Dev Center (Windows Store, Microsoft Advertising, Azure Marketplace, etc.).

segment.source: You cannot select different hold statuses for each revenue source.
segment.target: You cannot select different hold statuses for each revenue source.
